reviews.title: Great Interest rates.

reviews.title: West Brom BS ...  Vote With Your Feet
reviews.text:
West Brom BS have just mailed out to me an 11-page glossy booklet and 6 sheets of A4 paper in the post. One sheet has nothing but the BS logo plastered on to it and the standard regularity blurb etc. Acres of room for both exist within the covering letter ... ergo, one sheet is a pointless waste. 

All this paper is generated by the end of a 12-month online Regular Saver (Issue 7) at a fixed rate of 6%, which will auto transfer/renew at maturity into an new 'Access Regular Saver' at a derisory 2.10 % variable rate of interest (from 03.02.26). Vote with your feet when your fixed rate 6% Regular Saver is up and shift the maturity money to something so much better.

For balance, there is a decent Regular Saver in the West  Brom 'savings stable' but it is strictly a branch-based application; a product, by default, reserved for the chosen few that can actually get to one.   One could, if one where in the line of such speculation, venture to suggest that decision does not appear to align with the broader membership's interests. 

WB's promised digital overhaul - partnered with 10x banking and Deloitte's -  has the potential to be transformative. It is to be hoped that WB might also want to re-visit some core mutual values at the same time. However, with a 61 % 1-star rating as of the time of posting, I have not yet left the 'hope' stage ...

reviews.title: Really poor experience of ISA transfer request
reviews.text: I have been trying to effect an ISA transfer out of West Brom. Firstly they rejected a transfer request they "did not receive" because on the banking details the word Websave appeared (beware of this, which WBBS say is a "common error" causing delays). It then transpired that WBBS is not even on the banking system other than for "websave" accounts so it is easy to select the websave option when there is no other standard banking protocol for WBBS. I then completed 2 more forms of which I was told they "have no record" although my new ISA provider confirmed they had emailed them over. The latest of these has also been rejected because it contains a digital signature...it was a digital form which I had to send to my new ISA provider digitally! It really is time this outfit came into the 21st century. All the time losing interest and risking the transfer not being completed within the funding deadline for the new ISA, I now have to wait for WBBS to write to me and for me to return a form by post. I am extremely dissatisfied by these outdated policies.

reviews.title: Lack of 2 Factor Authentication when logging in
reviews.text:
The interest rates on savings are good, but I feel that on-line security could be improved by using 2 factor authentication as part of the log-in procedure (i.e send pass code to a mobile phone or email account). All other banks/building societies that I have accounts with use this before any account details are shown.
West Brom only requires name, dob and pincode to login and then all the savings accounts and balances are visible. 
I spoke to WB about my security concerns and was told that further authentication is prompted when moving money etc, but to me I would prefer 2 factor authentication before I was even able to see my account details.

reviews.title: Not a modern place to bank.
reviews.text:
I joined as at the time it was the best rate I could find 4.55%. However the rate they gave me was 4.33! So of course this annoyed me as I already had three accounts (2 in cahoot and 1 in Santander) that were a better rate. Google told me there was an app, but there is not! Double annoyed. But the final step for me was the fact it took 4 days for Â£20 to show up and 3 and half days for Â£2500 to show up. When I called in to chase up where the Â£20 was (Friday 1500 ish) the lady on the phone told me the account staff were not working!
Ive now taken all but Â£1 out of my account. Not really sure why I left, Â£1 in as I will never use it again. This is not modern banking. Transfers should be all but instant! % advertised should be the % given. If you want modern banking id stay clear.

reviews.title: Not a Premier League BS
reviews.text: I have had a WebSave Account for years often with many Â£000's in it. I decided to open a normal Savings account and on the online application form I ticked the WebSave customer box thinking it would fast track the process, oh boy how wrong was I !! The account opened after a few days but I received an email asking me to prove my ID and banking details by sending in pics of statements etc and it has to be in your full name, well my nominated account that has served them for many years isnt in my full name !!!..I contacted them by phone and pointed out the obvious and was told it was necessary to safe guard me , really !!! ...I advised I wasn't going to be a victim of their organisational structure.....So if you are a WebSaver customer don't assume that helps as they are on a different platform and there is no hands on cross checking unless you push hard. ....Importantly they have a process which fails if your nominated bank account is not under a full name and only has the initials for first and middle names plus surname. In the opening letter there is no information of what to do if you cannot meet that requirement !!...not very well thought through me thinks. Other Building Societies are much easier to deal with. I would welcome the opportunity to speak with their Senior Management

To make matters worse, their withdrawal process takes 3 working days, which feels incredibly outdated. Itâ€™s as if theyâ€™re stuck in the â€˜80s. Weâ€™ll be closing the account soon because there are far better options available.

However, after sharing my feedback, I received a call from Junaid, who sincerely apologised and worked to resolve the issue. However, this is now my complaint, I was told I could proceed because Iâ€™d already applied with my partner. To which I answered I know all of this but Iâ€™m now solely wanting the Morgage as I have done the last 2.5 years. I have been refused because â€œpolicyâ€ states I had applied jointly first. If Iâ€™d have know this prior I would have just applied and had got the extra solely. 
Iâ€™m livid as now Iâ€™m having to go with another company who has now accepted my application but I have to pay the redemption fee of Â£4000 because of a policy which in legal terms is not a stance. This is just someone in the company following a part policy which actually makes no sense. 
DO NOT USE WEST BROM. Your loyalty and customer service is none existent to them. 
To top it off their customer service and complaints will be informed by the advisor which will take 28 days or 56 for complaints procedure. By which time I am needing to proceed as we have a chain of people all waiting to move on. 
I advised that waiting this time by which I will only receive the standard apology letter doesnâ€™t quite help or problem solve this issue. An apology also doesnâ€™t quite cut it when Iâ€™m dealing with life like everyone else work, children and going through cancer treatment. 
The kick in the teeth is the Â£4000 that they will also get back because of a statement on a policy. 
Whoever is dealing with your internal policies and guidance needs to have a major look at what you are doing to people and also look at equitable guidelines. Thatâ€™s just what they are guidelines! 
I wonder if the would be kind enough to waiver the Â£4000 for being so incompetent, inconsistent in the guidelines and appalling customer service to loyal customers.

reviews.text:
I applied for an online 'WebSave' account,the automated opening process went pretty smoothly & my account was opened pretty swiftly,thereafter it went downhill RAPIDLY & my experience of this so called building society has been frighteningly amateurish.As another reviewer has mentioned they CLEARLY have major problems with their onboarding systems: as soon as I was told my account was opened I was sent another email advising that I must fund the account (which I obviously expected) I funded the account with a nominal Â£5 to begin with and this was from my 'nominated bank account ' using the details that they advised.The very next day I received another email stating that my electronic transfer had been rejected & the Â£5 would be returned to me)as it wasn't from my nominated bank account (it was!) and that my nominated bank account hadn't been sanctioned yet because I hadn't received the code in the post!! Fast forward 3 days later....letter received (shame they never mentioned this in the very beginning prior to requesting that I fund the account!!) and I get an email stating that my nominated account has been "approved".Fast forward 14 days and still no refund on the rejected payment,nothing heard from WestBrom so I fire off an internal message direct from my WebSave account....no acknowledgment,no response...NOTHING !! I rechecked everything as I began to think I'd lost the plot ,I checked all the original account numbers,all was exactly as requested by WestBrom,so as a test I sent another nominal amount (Â£1) .... nothing showing for days in my WebSave account,then I receive an email again requesting that I fund the account AGAIN !!!! By this time I'm starting to lose the will to live & bitterly regretting my choice of savings account,today I received another rejected payment & that this was again stated because it wasn't from my nominated bank account (it is from my nominated account....I checked yet again!!!).I sent another nominal Â£1 only this time putting in my actual WebSave account no in the reference field rather than the application reference which is what WestBroms original payment request email told me to do.....I am literally FLABERGASTED at the sheer incompetence of this useless & utterly shambollic 'Building Society'......the lack of customer service on ANY level speaks volumes and thankfully my initial payments are small (thankfully!) ....Can you imagine how I'd be feeling right now if I'd deposited a couple of thousand as my initial payment & it just disappears into the ether....?? An absolutely disgraceful way to run a financial services company.DO NOT ENTRUST YOUR SAVINGS WITH THIS INCOMPETENT SHOWER!!

Update 28/1/24: 

Still no reimbursement of funds sent to my websave account!! What a way to run a building society.... surely this is illegal?? I'm well aware the amounts we are talking about are minimal & this was done on purpose.....thank God I didn't send thousands (which was my original intention!) Absolutely unbelievable....

However, they rejected my mortgage application after being submitted due to some outstanding debt (that had been paid off with a payment never missed and a great credit rating) and held it against me due to being a first time buyer and a sole applicant (slightly discriminating). Iâ€™m now left stranded and worried my kid wonâ€™t be able to start at his primary school in September. I work in a job that pays me any where between Â£500-4.5k commission (what was sent on my payslips) on top of a good basic salary and car allowance. However, they will not take commission into consideration. 

I have two kids and my partner is currently staying at home with the littles onesâ€¦ with my youngest unfortunately disabled. 

West Bromâ€¦ there is much more to it, than declining a mortgage for the reasons aboveâ€¦ why offer a mortgage in principle in the first place? 

I find this really poor. Certainly a building society that doesnâ€™t hold any morals and I would strongly advise to avoid them, especially if you are in a similar situation to myself. 

My mortgage advisor has strongly argued the case with them but they wonâ€™t budge. 

PLEASE AVOID.

reviews.title: Avoid this company at all costs!

reviews.title: West Brom misleading, unfair and inefficient
reviews.text: West Brom advertise that they offer mortgages for mortgage prisoners using a modified affordability assessment. As I met all criteria I applied  but my application was badly handled by someone who was not a mortgage expert leading to 'chinese whispers' delivery of communication between myself and the decision makers . I was never permitted to talk to a qualified mortgage expert and my application was rejected on basis of  of  incomplete information interpreted and passed on by a call handler .  As well as satisfying all modified affordability assessment criteria  plus having other strong, additional elements making me a very low risk borrower, I was never permitted a reliable, fair interview with a decision maker.  Even my complaint was sent by the handler a few weeks ago - I wasn't given opportunity to write that myself either so I've no idea how they worded it and  I haven't heard anything in response.  I'm not sure what is going on with this company but they are very misleading  and certainly do not live up to what they state on their website plus are using under qualified staff to interpret  complex issues with a inadequate tick box system.
